formattedAddress: 500 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 500 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

editorialSummary.text: Upscale floating eatery serving American classics in elegant surroundings with East River views.

originalText.text: The Water Club was the perfect venue for my friend’s wedding!! We enjoyed every detail and moment there. The staff were friendly and welcoming

text.text: The Water Club was the perfect venue for my friend’s wedding!! We enjoyed every detail and moment there. The staff were friendly and welcoming

originalText.text: The Water Club was the most perfect venue I could have imagined for my August 2023 wedding! Everything detail was incredible from the food, the spaces, the views, and the dedicated staff. We had the pleasure of working with Elle and could not have felt luckier! She and her team flawlessly executed every detail of the wedding and not only accommodated, but went above and beyond for every special request we had. Elle was also incredibly responsive throughout the planning process and in the lead up to the wedding. All of our guests raved about the venue. The ceremony was beautifully set up and the Crow's Nest was the perfect venue for the cocktail hour and after party. We would highly recommend the Water Club to anybody looking for a beautiful, classic NYC venue with phenomenal service! The Water Club was easily the best choice we made for our wedding.

originalText.text: Great venue, beautiful and perfect spot for the summer. Very nice it’s right next to the river. Drinks, food and service has always been great when I come here. If I don’t arrive in a car I arrive on the Ferry.

text.text: Great venue, beautiful and perfect spot for the summer. Very nice it’s right next to the river. Drinks, food and service has always been great when I come here. If I don’t arrive in a car I arrive on the Ferry.

originalText.text: Cool place that let us make last minute reservations. They open at 12 p.m. Sundays every other day at 5 p.m. We made the reservation for Sunday brunch around 11:15 for the 12 p.m. brunch they gladly accepted us. Be careful getting there because you have to cross the FDR and try to avoid the runners/bikers in both directions it seems like everyone and their mama runs this path. Nicely decorated clean with a snooty feel but actually had very nice Waiters/hosts that check on you numerous times... I got up once during my meal and came back to a folded napkin and straightened area my friend informed me the waitress did that. The views of the East River were great and the food was surprisingly tasty I have to admit I thought it would be bland. They bring you warm cranberry scones and banana nut bread while you wait we got them straight out of the oven. Reservations should be highly considered this place fills up fast with groups of people and I do mean groups... about 98% were senior citizens dressed to the nines we felt kind of out of place for a minute but it was cool. I'm sure dinner time is a madhouse.

originalText.text: We recently hosted our wedding at The Water Club and it was an absolutely phenomenal experience. The venue, food, location and staff were top notch and made our day so special. Highly recommend!!
